title: Chief Operating Officer Job at Field Intelligence
content:
Field Intelligence - Where immunizations, contraception, anti-infectives, essential devices and diagnostics, or chronic care at the local clinic or pharmacy are expired, too expensive, or simply unavailable, providers, patients, and whole communities pay the price.

Equitable, sustainable development, and with it the promise of emerging and frontier markets, starts with the ability of health systems to deliver access. The challenge, opportunity, and imperative in that drive us. We are helping digitize, modernise, strengthen, and sustain the supply chains that enable this access, becoming long-term partners with the communities we serve, and helping make good on the promise of healthcare for millions.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full time

Job Description


	Field is looking for a seasoned professional for a management-track, full-time Chief Operating Officer role, leading and developing teams.  
	Strong leadership and strategic thinking are essential.


Key responsibilities
Data-driven strategy development and implementation with each department:


	Lead data strategy across Growth, Credit, Supply Chain, Customer Success, and Product departments
	Ensure successful use of data in departmental planning, problem solving, and reporting
	Lead training and capacity development across departments
	Collaborate with Finance to develop investment plans for new initiatives, including inventory investment case development, monitoring, and reporting


Data productization and monetization:


	Work with external stakeholders to define requirements and deliver data products and services
	Coordinate across Product and Data teams


Collaboration with Data Team:


	Stakeholder or owner for the upstream pipeline, process, and database improvement plans
	Development of the analytics team
	Primary stakeholder in the improvement of data tools and processes


Qualifications


	10+ years of experience
	Bachelor's or Master's Degree
	Both prior management consulting and operator experienceare  preferred
	Demonstrated quantitative reasoning and written communication skills
	Expertise in Excel/Sheets and SQL
	Excitement for healthcare, technology, including AI, emerging markets, and working in a fast-paced setting with diverse teams.

title: Video Editor / Graphic Designer Job at Speedaf Express
content:
Speedaf was established in 2019. We are a joint-venture company invested by Chinese leading express enterprises. Since founded, we continuously expanded global network, developed and optimized products, improved customer experience, and introduce IT technologies and equipment to realize automatic operations. Currently, we are building a local and cross-border service network to support air, sea and road transportation with the aim to be the leading diversified integrated logistics solution provider between China and emerging markets. By doing so, it will reduce end-to-end logistics costs between China and emerging markets while providing a stable and recognized logistics services to our customers.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Speedaf is localization-oriented, and we believe in creating both opportunities and possibilities of every region we operate in. We work with local teams and understand needs of customers. We offer a variety of products and value added service to cover different commercial or personal scenarios for our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Video Editor / Graphic Designer

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We’re seeking a creative and detail-oriented Video Editor & Graphic Designer to join our growing team.
	This role is responsible for creating visually compelling designs and video content that align with our brand, communicate our message, and engage customers, employees, and partners across various platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Create, edit, and produce high-quality videos for marketing campaigns, social media, internal communications, and training.
	Transform raw footage into polished videos with sound, motion graphics, and visual effects.
	Repurpose long-form content (e.g., webinars, interviews) into short, engaging clips.
	Maintain organized archives of video content.
	Design promotional materials such as flyers, banners, infographics, brochures, and social media posts.
	Collaborate with the content and marketing teams to develop visual campaigns that enhance brand awareness.
	Create branded templates for presentations, proposals, and internal documents.
	Maintain consistency of design and brand guidelines across all content.


Requirements


	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in video editing and graphic design.
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
	Strong understanding of storytelling, pacing, and visual communication.
	Experience creating assets for social media platforms (Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.).
	Excellent attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.
	Knowledge of animation and motion graphics is a strong plus.
	Familiarity with logistics or the e-commerce industry is an advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Creativity & innovation
	Strong communication skills
	Time management & ability to multitask
	Team collaboration
	Problem-solving mindset
	Adaptability in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@speedaf.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be selected.
